page.title: 15The flint knapper
page.content: A flint knapper is a person who skillfully chips flint into various sizes.He makes flints for flintlock guns which were invented in the 17th century.Mr.Fuller is now the only full time flint knapper in the world.He gets his flint from a mine in the South of England and he buys up to 30 tonnes per year. He starts his work in the summer because in the winter the flint is too wet and hard. He takes a piece of flint and hits it with his hammer and chisel so that flakes of flint come off. Mr. Fuller chips about 100 flakes an hour. He then takes the flakes into the shed to be shaped into various sizes. In this shed he has an extractor fan to get rid of the silica dust which comes off the flint.He is able to judge the size through experience.He sells the flint to America .
